page.title: 14COLD ASHTON'S W.I.
page.content: The{Cold Ashton Women's Institute was started in 1953 and meets in the Village Hall on the third Tuesday of each month excluding December.There are about 28{members}who live mainly in the Cold Ashton parish. The {programme}includes talks, filmshows, the resolution meeting and annual general meeting. Each month there is a competition, e.g. holiday photograph, flower arrangement,decorated egg etc.. A bring and buy stall is often held. {Outings}in 1984 included a visit to Priston Mill near Bath and an evening country walk ending at a country inn.Since the late 1950s, the institute has had close links with Lodge Causeway{Townswomens Guild}in Bristol.Lodge Causeway visit Cold Ashton in July and vice versa in the spring.
